Rays of light shining from behind the clouds after a storm, at sunset, shining down when looking up through the water while swimming, coming through the blinds in the shower (these ones looked almost solid with how they lit up the steam)
A saying "the sea is confused" with the wind blowing one way and the currents another, and the resulting rollercoaster boat ride back to Maui (but no worries, our captain was an Alaskan fisherman!)

Barely hearing dolphins on dive 1, then seeing the whole pod of spinners on the boat with most of them half-sleeping and including the babies spinning somtimes on the wrong axis right by the boat, then hearing them again midway through dive 2 and listening and looking and then the WHOLE pod swimming right by!
Burnt toast theory at play with my phone falling off the dock, strong currents and Portuguese Man O' War at the first dive sites, then the perfect dolphin encounter
me: "His tattoos are pretty sick" A: "Yeah, I think so to 😉"
Swimming through arches and caves (and Cathedral 1) when diving and seeing the bubbles on the ceiling and the light coming through

False alarm on watching the hawksbill nest after the "mass emergence" but then getting to watch (and help?!) the 10 last babies make it into the ocean-- the baby who flipped and was strong enough to flip back, and the big turtle watching in the waves, and everyone clapping at the end!
1000 piece Maui puzzle collab with S
Learning to appreciate the non-mammalian species while diving; all the fish with colors and patterns and flourescent urchins and schools and personalities
Snorkeling (swimming) at Ahihi, the black rocks/sand, following the turtles and the big one kicking out the little one from his hiding spot
Game and TV nights with the family-- Scrabble, Bananagrams (and the fake words R kept making!), that crazy Jason Momoa show, and the North Shore lifeguard show
So many observations of the patterns of water in light, in sand, on the surface, and on the ocean floor
